intro: Grandiphyllum auricula, commonly known as the golden ear plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive golden-yellow inflorescences that resemble ears, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, tubular flowers that are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant and unique appearance.
